text: Hey <@U6W3H6YN8> do you have a timeline to release this? I was just assigned, as my top priority, the task of formalizing the dev process with our new larger dev team working on our HubSpot sites.  I think this Docker model is the missing piece of the puzzle, but I need to know when it will be usable.
Also, will this release address the file structure discrepancy between ftp and local hubl?
Hi all, has anyone integrated <https://www.imgix.com/> with HubSpot? Specifically, changing the src for images in the frontend to reference a Imgix url.

you don’t really need to “integrate” it you just use the urls from imgix.

If all you need though is the resizing functionality HubSpot has you covered

Yeah what we are hoping for is modifying the output of HubSpot CMS to reference the Imgix URLs. We use it for a number of things (specifically cropping, resizing and building up responsive src-set image tags).

well, I guess you could do that by just having a set of fields in your custom modules, really though it seems kinda unnecessary, many of the marketers I  work with could probably figure out the URL parameters
I’ll see what I can get out of HubSpot’s image manipulation. Might be enough for me. Thanks for the help!
